Understate: The claim may be understating the issue by stating that only 25 percent of rural residents in Georgia lack access to high-speed internet. This could be an underestimate of the actual problem.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide specific evidence or data to support the statement that 25 percent of rural residents in Georgia lack access to high-speed internet. It only refers to a presentation and report without providing direct evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not explore alternative reasons or factors that may contribute to the lack of high-speed internet access in rural areas of Georgia. It solely focuses on the cost of infrastructure buildout as the largest factor, without considering other potential factors.
